DataElement.preferredName: Prior First Clinical Study Pharmacologic Substance Administration Received Radiation Therapy Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient received radiotherapy prior to first study drug administration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior First Clinical Study Pharmacologic Substance Administration Received Radiation Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._To take, accept, or get something offered._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior First Clinical Study Pharmacologic Substance Administration
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received prior full field radiotherapy less than or equal to 4 weeks or limited field radiotherapy less than or equal to 2 weeks prior to first study drug administration?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior full field radiotherapy less than or equal to 4 weeks or limited field radiotherapy less than or equal to 2 weeks prior to first study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received radiothe
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiotherapy prior to first study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to the first dose of the study regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior WBRT or has SRS/SRT/fractionated boost or neurosurgery after WBRT has been planned upfront?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving radiation therapy during the screening and treatment phases (including retreatment for post-complete response relapse) of this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior radiation therapy within 3 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received or is scheduled to receive radiation therapy within 7 days or less from gemcitabine administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 14 days elapsed from local radiotherapy to initiation of protocol therapy or at least 150 days from total body irradiation (TBI), craniospinal radiotherapy, or radiation to greater than or equal to 50% of the pelvis or at least 42 days from other substantial bone marrow radiation?

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
